data.text:
Full Name

Janet Cole

Birthdate

November 12, 1922

Birthplace

Detroit, Michigan, USA

Date of Death

September 11, 2002 (age 79)

Cause of Death

heart attack

Occupation

Actress

Years Active

1979-1997

Kim Hunter was a well known movie star prior to appearing on daytime television. Hunter appeared in the Planet of the Apes movies and A Streetcar Name Desire among numerous others. Hunter made appearances on daytime from 1979-1980 as Nola Madison on The Edge of Night. Hunter later appeared on All My Children in 1993 and As the World Turns in 1997. Hunter died on September 11, 2002 of a heart attack.

Personal Life[]

Hunter was married to Robert Emmett (1951-2000; his death) and they had one child: Sean (b. 1954). Hunter was also married to William A. Baldwin (1944-1946) and they had one child.

Soapography[]

Nola Madison on The Edge of Night (1979-1980)

Faye Perth on All My Children (1993)

Nurse/Mrs. Thompkins on As the World Turns (1997)

Awards and Nominations[]

Daytime Emmy Awards

YEAR CATEGORY CHARACTER/SERIES W/N 1980 Lead Actress Nola Madison, The Edge of Night N

Academy Awards

YEAR CATEGORY TITLE W/N 1952 Best Supporting Actress A Streetcar Named Desire W

Golden Globes

YEAR CATEGORY TITLE W/N 1952 Best Supporting Actress A Streetcar Named Desire W

Honors

Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame (Hunter has one for her movie contributions and one for her television contributions)
